Docs.summary: Represents a persistent connection between multiple devices.

remarks.para: Multipeer Connectivity has two phases: discovery and the session. The role of the discovery phase is to associate an object on each device with an object on the peer devices. In the session phase, the object is the channel through which devices communicate and its lifecycle events are associated with connections, disconnections, transmissions, and receptions.

The is instantiated by the application developer. During the discovery phase, there are two roles: advertisers that broadcast their willingness to connect to a certain protocol and browsers that discover these advertisers and invite them to sessions.

Advertising is managed by either the stock or custom controller that uses a . Similarly, browsing is managed by a T:MultipeerConnectivity.UIViewController, either the stock or a custom controller that uses a object to programmatically discover peers. Once a peer is discovered, an invitation is sent with ). The application user interacts with a system dialog informing them of the invitation. If they accept, the connects.
